content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma with liver metastases
MET amplification positive on molecular profiling

Previous treatment:
Gemcitabine/Nab-paclitaxel - 6 cycles completed March 2024
FOLFIRINOX - commenced April 2024

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg bd
Dexamethasone 4mg bd on days 1-3 of chemotherapy
Creon 25,000 units with meals
Oxycodone MR 30mg bd

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Cycle 4 FOLFIRINOX review

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 FOLFIRINOX. The previous cycle was complicated by grade 2 neutropenia requiring 1 week delay, but otherwise tolerating treatment well with good control of nausea and stable pain. Performance status remains 1. Latest CT shows stable disease in both pancreatic primary and liver metastases, with CA19-9 trending down from 1200 to 850.

Examination shows no new concerns. Blood results today show improvement in neutrophils to 1.8, platelets stable at 156. Liver function remains within acceptable range for treatment.

Plan to proceed with cycle 4 today at 80% dose for all agents given previous neutropenia. Will arrange CT reassessment after cycle 6. To continue with weekly blood tests and review again in 2 weeks pre cycle 5.

cancer_timeline.value: One week delay due to grade 2 neutropenia
CT shows stable disease in both pancreatic primary and liver metastases

patient_facts.value: Neutrophils 1.8, platelets 156, liver function within acceptable range

status_updates.value: Metastatic pancreatic cancer with stable disease on FOLFIRINOX, managing treatment despite neutropenia
Proceeding with cycle 4 FOLFIRINOX at 80% dose for all agents
CT reassessment after cycle 6, weekly blood tests
